intro: Gonospermum ferulaceum var. ferulaceum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed gonospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
